Test Case Title: Validate logging into the Application using valid credentials
Pre-requisites:
1. Open the Application URL (https://demo.opencart.com) in any supported Browser
2. Login credentials for an existing account are required
Test Steps:
1. Click on 'My Account' Dropmenu
2. Click on 'Login' option (Validate ER-1)
3. Enter valid email address into the 'E-Mail Address' field - <Refer Test Data>
4. Enter valid password into the 'Password' field - <Refer Test Data>
5. Click on 'Login' button (Validate ER-2)
Expected Result (ER):
1.User should be navigated to Login page
2.User should get logged in and taken to the 'Account' page
Actual Result:
1. User is navigated to Login page
2.User got logged in and taken to the 'Account' page

Test Case Title: Validate logging into the Application using invalid credentials (i.e. Invalid email address and Invalid Password)
Pre-requisites: Open the Application URL (https://demo.opencart.com) in any supported Browser
Test Steps:
1. Click on 'My Account' Dropmenu
2. Click on 'Login' option 
3. Enter invalid email address into the 'E-Mail Address' field - <Refer Test Data>
4. Enter invalid password into the 'Password' field - <Refer Test Data>
5. Click on 'Login' button (Validate ER-1)
Expected Result (ER): 1. Warning message with the text 'Warning: No match for E-Mail Address and/or Password.' should be displayed
Actual Result: Warning message with the text 'Warning: No match for E-Mail Address and/or Password.' got displayed

Test Case Title: Validate logging into the Application using Keyboard keys (Tab and Enter)
Pre-requisites: Open the Application URL (https://demo.opencart.com) in any supported Browser
Test Steps:
1. Click on 'My Account' Dropmenu
2. Click on 'Login' option 
3. Press Tab keyboard key until the control comes to the E-Mail Address text field and enter the valid email address - <Refer Test Data>
4. Press Tab keyboard key to move the control to Password text field and enter the valid password - <Refer Test Data>
5. Press Tab keyboard key until the control comes 'Login' button and press 'Enter' key to submit (ER-1)
Expected Result (ER): 1. User should be able to log into the application
Actual Result: User is able to log into the application

Test Case Title: Validate the number of unsucessful login attemps
Pre-requisites: Open the Application URL (https://demo.opencart.com) in any supported Browser
Test Steps:
1. Click on 'My Account' Dropmenu
2. Click on 'Login' option 
3. Enter invalid email address into the 'E-Mail Address' field - <Refer Test Data>
4. Enter invalid password into the 'Password' field - <Refer Test Data>
5. Click on 'Login' button 
6. Repeat Step 5 for 4 more times (ER-1)
Expected Result (ER): 1. Warning message with the text ' Warning: Your account has exceeded allowed number of login attempts. Please try again in 1 hour.' should be displayed for the 5th time of clicking the 'Login' button with the same invalid credentials
Actual Result: Warning message with the text ' Warning: Your account has exceeded allowed number of login attempts. Please try again in 1 hour.' is displayed for the 5th time of clicking the 'Login' button with the same invalid credentials

Test Case Title: Validate the text into the Password field is toggled to hide its visibility
Pre-requisites: Open the Application URL (https://demo.opencart.com) in any supported Browser
Test Steps:
1. Click on 'My Account' Dropmenu
2. Click on 'Login' option 
3. Enter any text into the 'Password' field (ER-1)
Expected Result (ER): 1.Text entered into the Password field should be toggled to hide its visibility (i.e. Instead of entered characters getting dispalyed, the Password field should show either * or . Symbols)
Actual Result: Text entered into the Password field is toggled to hide its visibility (i.e. Instead of entered characters getting dispalyed, the Password field should show either * or . Symbols)

Test Case Title: Validate the copying of the text entered into the Password field
Pre-requisites: Open the Application URL (https://demo.opencart.com) in any supported Browser
Test Steps:
1. Click on 'My Account' Dropmenu
2. Click on 'Login' option 
3. Enter any text into the 'Password' field
4. Select the text entered into the 'Password' field, right click to select 'Copy' option (ER-1)
5. Select the text entered into the 'Password' field and press (Ctrl+C) shorcut for copying (ER-2)
Expected Result (ER):
1. Copy option in the Right click menu should be disabled
2. Password text should not be copied
Actual Result:
1. Copy option in the Right click menu is disabled
2. Cannot copy Password text

Test Case Title: Validate Logging into the Application after changing the password
Pre-requisites: Open the Application URL (https://demo.opencart.com) in any supported Browser
Test Steps:
1. Click on 'My Account' Dropmenu
2. Click on 'Login' option (Validate ER-1)
3. Enter valid email address into the 'E-Mail Address' field - <Refer Test Data>
4. Enter valid password into the 'Password' field - <Refer Test Data>
5. Click on 'Login' button 
6. Click on 'Change your password' link
7. Enter new password into the 'Password' and 'Password Confirm' fields
8. Click on 'Continue' button
9. Click on 'My Account' Dropmenu and select 'Logout' option
10. Repeat steps 1 to 5 (ER-1)
11. Enter new credentials given in Step 7 and click on 'Login' button (ER-2)
Expected Result (ER):
1. User should not be allowed to login
2. User should be able to login
Actual Result:
1. User is not allowed to login with old credentials
2. User is able to login with new credentials

Test Case Title: Validate Logging into the Application, closing the Browser without loggingout and opening the application in the Browser again
Pre-requisites: Open the Application URL (https://demo.opencart.com) in any supported Browser
Test Steps:
1. Click on 'My Account' Dropmenu
2. Click on 'Login' option (Validate ER-1)
3. Enter valid email address into the 'E-Mail Address' field - <Refer Test Data>
4. Enter valid password into the 'Password' field - <Refer Test Data>
5. Click on 'Login' button 
6. Close the Browser
7. Open the Browser and open the Application URL (ER-1)
Expected Result (ER): 1. Loggedin Sesion should be still maintained and User should not get logged out
Actual Result: Loggedin Sesion is maintained and User has not logged out

Test Case Title: Validate timeout of the Login Session
Pre-requisites: Open the Application URL (https://demo.opencart.com) in any supported Browser
Test Steps:
1. Click on 'My Account' Dropmenu
2. Click on 'Login' option (Validate ER-1)
3. Enter valid email address into the 'E-Mail Address' field - <Refer Test Data>
4. Enter valid password into the 'Password' field - <Refer Test Data>
5. Click on 'Login' button
6. Wait for more than 30 minutes without performing anything on the Application
7. Perform any action on the Application
Expected Result (ER): 1. User should get automatically logged out with a proper message stating your session got expired.
Actual Result: 1. User is not getting automatically logged out with a proper message stating your session got expired.

1. User is navigated to 'Register Account' page
